siteMetadata.title: APIdocs documentation
siteMetadata.description: APIdocs is an opinionated Gatsby template for writing technical documentation. Clone, customize and start documenting.

index.searchable: APIdocs can highlight code blocks in your documentation using Highlight.js.

searchablePrepared.target: APIdocs can highlight code blocks in your documentation using Highlight.js.

index.searchable: To mark a block-level code fragment for highlighting, use the pre tag with the data-language attribute defining the language of the contents. See the Highlight.js list of supported languages for the attribute values to use.

searchablePrepared.target: To mark a block-level code fragment for highlighting, use the pre tag with the data-language attribute defining the language of the contents. See the Highlight.js list of supported languages for the attribute values to use.

index.searchable: The following pre code block is marked as one containing JavaScript:

searchablePrepared.target: The following pre code block is marked as one containing JavaScript:

index.searchable: The block will be rendered as:

searchablePrepared.target: The block will be rendered as:

index.searchable: To make a code block stand out more, you can enclose it in a figure and provide a figcaption. The search engine will index the caption and tag it as a code example in search results.

searchablePrepared.target: To make a code block stand out more, you can enclose it in a figure and provide a figcaption. The search engine will index the caption and tag it as a code example in search results.

index.searchable: The following figure:

searchablePrepared.target: The following figure:

index.searchable: will be rendered as:

searchablePrepared.target: will be rendered as:

index.searchable: Additionally, if you add an id attribute to your figure, the figure will be available as a special entity in search results. You can test this by typing sched in the search box above.

searchablePrepared.target: Additionally, if you add an id attribute to your figure, the figure will be available as a special entity in search results. You can test this by typing sched in the search box above.

index.searchable: Use the data-embed attribute of the pre tag to embed code from an external file:

searchablePrepared.target: Use the data-embed attribute of the pre tag to embed code from an external file:

index.searchable: The path to the embedded file is resolved relatively to the HTML file it appears in.

searchablePrepared.target: The path to the embedded file is resolved relatively to the HTML file it appears in.

index.searchable: When embedding fragments of real code, it may be useful to hide certain lines. See the code annotations section for special comments you can use to achieve that.

searchablePrepared.target: When embedding fragments of real code, it may be useful to hide certain lines. See the code annotations section for special comments you can use to achieve that.

index.searchable: In some cases you may want to embed only a fragment of an external file. To do so, add special fragment start and end markers to the external file along with a fragment identifier that you will later provide to the pre tag.

searchablePrepared.target: In some cases you may want to embed only a fragment of an external file. To do so, add special fragment start and end markers to the external file along with a fragment identifier that you will later provide to the pre tag.

index.searchable: Fragment markers have the following syntax:

searchablePrepared.target: Fragment markers have the following syntax:

index.searchable: fragment-start{frag_id}: start of the fragment with identifier frag_id,

searchablePrepared.target: fragment-start{frag_id}: start of the fragment with identifier frag_id,

index.searchable: fragment-end{frag_id}: end of the fragment with identifier frag_id.

searchablePrepared.target: fragment-end{frag_id}: end of the fragment with identifier frag_id.

index.searchable: You can place the markers in the comment sections specific to the language you're embedding.

searchablePrepared.target: You can place the markers in the comment sections specific to the language you're embedding.

index.searchable: When embedding the external file using the pre tag, specify the identifier of the fragment to embed using the data-fragment attribute:

searchablePrepared.target: When embedding the external file using the pre tag, specify the identifier of the fragment to embed using the data-fragment attribute:

index.searchable: Please note the following issues when embedding fragments:

searchablePrepared.target: Please note the following issues when embedding fragments:

index.searchable: One fragment can consist of multiple non-overlapping sections of code. Just use the same fragment identifier in multiple start and end markers.

searchablePrepared.target: One fragment can consist of multiple non-overlapping sections of code. Just use the same fragment identifier in multiple start and end markers.

index.searchable: Lines containing fragment markers nested inside a fragment are removed. This ensures that markers of nested fragments are not transferred to your documentation.

searchablePrepared.target: Lines containing fragment markers nested inside a fragment are removed. This ensures that markers of nested fragments are not transferred to your documentation.

index.searchable: You can use highlighting annotations inside the fragments you embed.

searchablePrepared.target: You can use highlighting annotations inside the fragments you embed.

index.searchable: You can use variables inside the file paths you specify in the data-embed attribute of the pre tag. This may help to externalize paths of the folders containing files to embed.

searchablePrepared.target: You can use variables inside the file paths you specify in the data-embed attribute of the pre tag. This may help to externalize paths of the folders containing files to embed.

index.searchable: Assuming that the CODE_EXAMPLES variable is defined to contain the path to the directory with files to embed, you can reference it like this:

searchablePrepared.target: Assuming that the CODE_EXAMPLES variable is defined to contain the path to the directory with files to embed, you can reference it like this:

index.searchable: APIdocs does not verify the file paths provided in the data-embed attribute. Make sure they don't and can't reference any sensitive data in your system.

searchablePrepared.target: APIdocs does not verify the file paths provided in the data-embed attribute. Make sure they don't and can't reference any sensitive data in your system.

index.searchable: You can use special comments in both in-line and embedded code to highlight and hide individual lines or ranges of lines.

searchablePrepared.target: You can use special comments in both in-line and embedded code to highlight and hide individual lines or ranges of lines.

index.searchable: The following special comments are supported:

searchablePrepared.target: The following special comments are supported:

index.searchable: highlight-line: highlights the current line;

searchablePrepared.target: highlight-line: highlights the current line;

index.searchable: highlight-next-line: highlights the next line, removes the line containing the comment;

searchablePrepared.target: highlight-next-line: highlights the next line, removes the line containing the comment;

index.searchable: highlight-range{4-7}: highlights lines 4–7, line 1 is the next line; removes the line containing the comment;

searchablePrepared.target: highlight-range{4-7}: highlights lines 4–7, line 1 is the next line; removes the line containing the comment;

index.searchable: hide-line: hides the current line,

searchablePrepared.target: hide-line: hides the current line,

index.searchable: hide-next-line: hides the next line,

searchablePrepared.target: hide-next-line: hides the next line,

index.searchable: hide-range{2-4}: hides lines 2–4, line 1 is the next line.

searchablePrepared.target: hide-range{2-4}: hides lines 2–4, line 1 is the next line.

index.searchable: Use comment syntax specific to the language to place annotation comments. The following code comments:

searchablePrepared.target: Use comment syntax specific to the language to place annotation comments. The following code comments:

index.searchable: produce the following code block:

searchablePrepared.target: produce the following code block:

index.searchable: APIdocs will by default remove the indentation that is common to all lines of the included or embedded code block. This makes it easier to preserve proper formatting of the documentation source code and the external source code you embed.

searchablePrepared.target: APIdocs will by default remove the indentation that is common to all lines of the included or embedded code block. This makes it easier to preserve proper formatting of the documentation source code and the external source code you embed.

index.searchable: If for some reason you'd like to preserve the common indentation, set the the data-preserve-common-indent attribute to true:

searchablePrepared.target: If for some reason you'd like to preserve the common indentation, set the the data-preserve-common-indent attribute to true:

index.searchable: APIdocs by default removes leading and trailing new lines of the code block you embed. This strips unnecessary margins from the pre blocks.

searchablePrepared.target: APIdocs by default removes leading and trailing new lines of the code block you embed. This strips unnecessary margins from the pre blocks.

index.searchable: To preserve leading and trailing new lines, set the the data-preserve-leading-and-trailing-newlines attribute to true:

searchablePrepared.target: To preserve leading and trailing new lines, set the the data-preserve-leading-and-trailing-newlines attribute to true:

index.searchable: APIdocs is an opinionated theme built for a specific set of software products in mind. For this reason, the number of options you can configure is currently limited.

searchablePrepared.target: APIdocs is an opinionated theme built for a specific set of software products in mind. For this reason, the number of options you can configure is currently limited.

index.searchable: The gatsby-theme-apidocs theme exposes the following options:

searchablePrepared.target: The gatsby-theme-apidocs theme exposes the following options:

index.searchable: The base path to assume when converting HTML content file paths to page identifiers. For example, if your configuration sources HTML files from the src/content directory, set basePath to src/content.

searchablePrepared.target: The base path to assume when converting HTML content file paths to page identifiers. For example, if your configuration sources HTML files from the src/content directory, set basePath to src/content.

index.searchable: Path to the navigation JSON file.

searchablePrepared.target: Path to the navigation JSON file.

index.searchable: Path to the site logo file.

searchablePrepared.target: Path to the site logo file.

index.searchable: Path to the site footer file.

searchablePrepared.target: Path to the site footer file.

index.searchable: A map of variables and their values to use during variable substitution.

searchablePrepared.target: A map of variables and their values to use during variable substitution.

index.searchable: Some properties of your site can be configured in the siteMetadata section of gatsby-config.js.

searchablePrepared.target: Some properties of your site can be configured in the siteMetadata section of gatsby-config.js.

index.searchable: The string to use in the head > title tag of the resulting HTML.

searchablePrepared.target: The string to use in the head > title tag of the resulting HTML.

index.searchable: The text to use in the description meta tag. This is the one you want to edit for good SEO results.

searchablePrepared.target: The text to use in the description meta tag. This is the one you want to edit for good SEO results.

index.searchable: The contents of the lang attribute of the html tag.

searchablePrepared.target: The contents of the lang attribute of the html tag.

index.searchable: Identifier of the page to copy to be served at the root / URL of your site. Use both leading and trailing slash when providing the alias, for example: /getting-started/.

searchablePrepared.target: Identifier of the page to copy to be served at the root / URL of your site. Use both leading and trailing slash when providing the alias, for example: /getting-started/.

index.searchable: Editing navigation

searchablePrepared.target: Editing navigation

index.searchable: When adding new pages to your documentation, you'll need to link them at some place in the navigation menu.

searchablePrepared.target: When adding new pages to your documentation, you'll need to link them at some place in the navigation menu.

index.searchable: By default, the left-hand-side navigation of your documentation site is defined in the src/navigation.json file. Currently, only two-level navigation is supported.

searchablePrepared.target: By default, the left-hand-side navigation of your documentation site is defined in the src/navigation.json file. Currently, only two-level navigation is supported.

index.searchable: The navigation JSON file groups pages (articles) in your site into chapters:

searchablePrepared.target: The navigation JSON file groups pages (articles) in your site into chapters:

index.searchable: The articles array lists identifiers of pages to link to the specific chapter. An identifier of getting-started, for example, will be mapped to content/getting-started.html.

searchablePrepared.target: The articles array lists identifiers of pages to link to the specific chapter. An identifier of getting-started, for example, will be mapped to content/getting-started.html.

index.searchable: Please note that a page will not appear in the menu until you create its corresponding HTML file. A warning will be logged to DevTools console.

searchablePrepared.target: Please note that a page will not appear in the menu until you create its corresponding HTML file. A warning will be logged to DevTools console.

searchablePrepared.target: The outline of a typical APIdocs HTML page source.

index.searchable: A 2d map visualization of 3.5k medical paper abstracts related to vaccines produced by Lingo4G and visualized by dotAtlas.

searchablePrepared.target: A 2d map visualization of 3.5k medical paper abstracts related to vaccines produced by Lingo4G and visualized by dotAtlas.

index.searchable: Lingo3G Clustering Workbench.

searchablePrepared.target: Lingo3G Clustering Workbench.

index.searchable: Lingo3G Clustering Workbench.

index.searchable: Info in search results.

searchablePrepared.target: Info in search results.

index.searchable: Warnings in search results.

searchablePrepared.target: Warnings in search results.

index.searchable: Use plain, semantic HTML to write your documentation. APIdocs will take care of ToC generation, code highlighting, image processing and full-text search.

searchablePrepared.target: Use plain, semantic HTML to write your documentation. APIdocs will take care of ToC generation, code highlighting, image processing and full-text search.

index.searchable: Below is the outline of a typical APIdocs page.

searchablePrepared.target: Below is the outline of a typical APIdocs page.

index.searchable: Introduction.
parents: The outline of a typical APIdocs HTML page source.

searchablePrepared.target: Introduction.

index.searchable: Section 1 content.
parents: The outline of a typical APIdocs HTML page source.

searchablePrepared.target: Section 1 content.

index.searchable: Here are some rules about the structure of page HTMLs:

searchablePrepared.target: Here are some rules about the structure of page HTMLs:

index.searchable: In most cases, each APIdocs page will be an article covering a specific aspect of your software.

searchablePrepared.target: In most cases, each APIdocs page will be an article covering a specific aspect of your software.

index.searchable: The root element of each page HTML file must be an HTML article.

searchablePrepared.target: The root element of each page HTML file must be an HTML article.

index.searchable: Each article must have a child h1 element containing the article's title. APIdocs will use its contents to refer to the page in navigation links.

searchablePrepared.target: Each article must have a child h1 element containing the article's title. APIdocs will use its contents to refer to the page in navigation links.

index.searchable: Use HTML section tags to divide your article into sections. Put section titles in HTML heading tags (h2, h3 etc.) inside the section tag. Do not use heading tags outside of sections.

searchablePrepared.target: Use HTML section tags to divide your article into sections. Put section titles in HTML heading tags (h2, h3 etc.) inside the section tag. Do not use heading tags outside of sections.

index.searchable: If you would like a section to appear in the per-article table of contents, add an id attribute to that section. Additionally, sections with id attributes will have their heading submitted to the search index.

searchablePrepared.target: If you would like a section to appear in the per-article table of contents, add an id attribute to that section. Additionally, sections with id attributes will have their heading submitted to the search index.

index.searchable: Use typical HTML text elements as you'd normally do in a regular HTML page. Use p to delimit paragraphs, ul and ol for lists, ul for definition lists, strong and em for emphasis.

searchablePrepared.target: Use typical HTML text elements as you'd normally do in a regular HTML page. Use p to delimit paragraphs, ul and ol for lists, ul for definition lists, strong and em for emphasis.

index.searchable: Some notes regarding text elements:

searchablePrepared.target: Some notes regarding text elements:

index.searchable: The search index uses paragraphs as the basic indexing unit. Keeping paragraphs short will not only make them easier to read, but also improve the search experience.

searchablePrepared.target: The search index uses paragraphs as the basic indexing unit. Keeping paragraphs short will not only make them easier to read, but also improve the search experience.

index.searchable: Do not use strong and em tags outside of paragraphs. Otherwise, their contents will not be indexed by the search engine.

searchablePrepared.target: Do not use strong and em tags outside of paragraphs. Otherwise, their contents will not be indexed by the search engine.

index.searchable: For lists with short entries, put the text directly in the li tags. For lists with longer entries, put one or more p paragraphs inside the li. Both variants are handled by the search engine.

searchablePrepared.target: For lists with short entries, put the text directly in the li tags. For lists with longer entries, put one or more p paragraphs inside the li. Both variants are handled by the search engine.

index.searchable: Use HTML a tags to link to other pages of your documentation or to external resources.

searchablePrepared.target: Use HTML a tags to link to other pages of your documentation or to external resources.

index.searchable: Use relative href attributes to link to other pages of your documentation. APIdocs will rewrite such links to point to the final page URLs.

searchablePrepared.target: Use relative href attributes to link to other pages of your documentation. APIdocs will rewrite such links to point to the final page URLs.

index.searchable: Use #-style anchors to go to specific parts of the same or other page:

searchablePrepared.target: Use #-style anchors to go to specific parts of the same or other page:

index.searchable: Use absolute URLs to link to external resources. APIdocs will not modify such URLs.

searchablePrepared.target: Use absolute URLs to link to external resources. APIdocs will not modify such URLs.

index.searchable: Use img tags to embed images in your documentation. APIdocs will turn each such element into a responsive image that scales to take the whole width of the page. We will also generate optimized versions of the image in different resolutions, so that the appropriate version can be served depending on the user's device and viewport size.

searchablePrepared.target: Use img tags to embed images in your documentation. APIdocs will turn each such element into a responsive image that scales to take the whole width of the page. We will also generate optimized versions of the image in different resolutions, so that the appropriate version can be served depending on the user's device and viewport size.

index.searchable: Like with code examples, you can wrap an img tag in a figure and provide a figcaption to have the image described and treated specially in search results. Additionally, images inside the figure tag, when clicked, will zoom-in for full-screen viewing.

searchablePrepared.target: Like with code examples, you can wrap an img tag in a figure and provide a figcaption to have the image described and treated specially in search results. Additionally, images inside the figure tag, when clicked, will zoom-in for full-screen viewing.

index.searchable: The following markup:

searchablePrepared.target: The following markup:

index.searchable: will render the following figure:

searchablePrepared.target: will render the following figure:

index.searchable: Textually-similar abstracts are clustered together on the map. The panel on the right shows the top abstracts lying in the map region described as measles vaccine. Phases specific to the selected map region are highlighted in the text of the abstract.
parents: A 2d map visualization of 3.5k medical paper abstracts related to vaccines produced by Lingo4G and visualized by dotAtlas.

searchablePrepared.target: Textually-similar abstracts are clustered together on the map. The panel on the right shows the top abstracts lying in the map region described as measles vaccine. Phases specific to the selected map region are highlighted in the text of the abstract.

index.searchable: You can provide separate images to show for the light and dark theme. To do this, include two img tags with light and dark CSS classes. APIDocs will show one of the images depending on the currently selected theme.

searchablePrepared.target: You can provide separate images to show for the light and dark theme. To do this, include two img tags with light and dark CSS classes. APIDocs will show one of the images depending on the currently selected theme.

index.searchable: The following markup:

searchablePrepared.target: The following markup:

index.searchable: will render the following image. Change the documentation theme to see the image change to match the new theme.

searchablePrepared.target: will render the following image. Change the documentation theme to see the image change to match the new theme.

index.searchable: You can embed SVG images in your documentation by putting the graphics in the in-line svg element. SVG images inside the figure tag, when clicked, will zoom-in for full-screen viewing.

searchablePrepared.target: You can embed SVG images in your documentation by putting the graphics in the in-line svg element. SVG images inside the figure tag, when clicked, will zoom-in for full-screen viewing.

index.searchable: Use a div with class name info to generate an information box. A standalone strong tag can serve as the heading of the warning.

searchablePrepared.target: Use a div with class name info to generate an information box. A standalone strong tag can serve as the heading of the warning.

index.searchable: Warning boxes get a special icon when presented in search results. Type info in the search box to find out.

searchablePrepared.target: Warning boxes get a special icon when presented in search results. Type info in the search box to find out.

index.searchable: Use a div with class name warning to generate a warning box. A standalone strong tag can serve as the heading of the warning.

searchablePrepared.target: Use a div with class name warning to generate a warning box. A standalone strong tag can serve as the heading of the warning.

index.searchable: Warning boxes get a special icon when presented in search results. Type warning in the search box to find out.

searchablePrepared.target: Warning boxes get a special icon when presented in search results. Type warning in the search box to find out.

index.searchable: Customization

searchablePrepared.target: Customization

index.searchable: Site logo

searchablePrepared.target: Site logo

index.searchable: Site footer

searchablePrepared.target: Site footer

index.searchable: Custom CSS

searchablePrepared.target: Custom CSS

index.searchable: APIdocs was created for documenting our software products at Carrot Search, so its customization options are limited. You can still customize the basic things like site logo, footer and add your own CSS.

searchablePrepared.target: APIdocs was created for documenting our software products at Carrot Search, so its customization options are limited. You can still customize the basic things like site logo, footer and add your own CSS.

index.searchable: Site logo is by default read from src/logo.html. Contents of this file will be inserted in the site's logo place holder in the upper left corner of the page. The file must contain valid HTML, there can be one or more tags on the first level, you can also use SVG.

searchablePrepared.target: Site logo is by default read from src/logo.html. Contents of this file will be inserted in the site's logo place holder in the upper left corner of the page. The file must contain valid HTML, there can be one or more tags on the first level, you can also use SVG.

index.searchable: You can style your logo either by inline CSS styles in src/logo.html or by editing src/styles/custom.css.

searchablePrepared.target: You can style your logo either by inline CSS styles in src/logo.html or by editing src/styles/custom.css.

index.searchable: In development mode, all changes to the logo HTML will be applied in real time to the site preview.

searchablePrepared.target: In development mode, all changes to the logo HTML will be applied in real time to the site preview.

index.searchable: Site footer is by default read from src/footer.html. Contents of the file will be appended below the main article. The file must contain valid HTML. Ideally, the footer should be contained in a single footer tag, though multiple root-level elements are allowed too. You can use SVG, if needed.

searchablePrepared.target: Site footer is by default read from src/footer.html. Contents of the file will be appended below the main article. The file must contain valid HTML. Ideally, the footer should be contained in a single footer tag, though multiple root-level elements are allowed too. You can use SVG, if needed.

index.searchable: You will most likely style place styles for your footer in src/styles/custom.css.

searchablePrepared.target: You will most likely style place styles for your footer in src/styles/custom.css.

index.searchable: In development mode, all changes to the footer HTML will be applied in real time to the site preview.

searchablePrepared.target: In development mode, all changes to the footer HTML will be applied in real time to the site preview.

index.searchable: You can place extra CSS styles in src/styles/custom.css. You can use that file to style logo and footer as well as tweak the appearance of the whole site.

searchablePrepared.target: You can place extra CSS styles in src/styles/custom.css. You can use that file to style logo and footer as well as tweak the appearance of the whole site.

index.searchable: The CSS file will be processed by Webpack running inside Gatsby, so you can use all Webpack magic, like importing webfonts directly from npm dependencies.

searchablePrepared.target: The CSS file will be processed by Webpack running inside Gatsby, so you can use all Webpack magic, like importing webfonts directly from npm dependencies.

index.searchable: In development mode, all changes to the custom CSS will be applied in real time to the site preview.

searchablePrepared.target: In development mode, all changes to the custom CSS will be applied in real time to the site preview.

index.searchable: Hello APIDocs!

searchablePrepared.target: Hello APIDocs!

index.searchable: APIdocs is an opinionated Gatsby.JS theme for writing technical documentation. Clone, customize and start documenting.

searchablePrepared.target: APIdocs is an opinionated Gatsby.JS theme for writing technical documentation. Clone, customize and start documenting.

index.searchable: Out-of-the-box, APIdocs comes with:

searchablePrepared.target: Out-of-the-box, APIdocs comes with:

index.searchable: To get started, follow the quick start tutorial. See editing navigation and further articles for more in-depth documentation. You can also check out gatsbyjs.org for some basics of Gatsby.

searchablePrepared.target: To get started, follow the quick start tutorial. See editing navigation and further articles for more in-depth documentation. You can also check out gatsbyjs.org for some basics of Gatsby.

index.searchable: HTML-based content authoring,

searchablePrepared.target: HTML-based content authoring,

index.searchable: responsive, mobile-friendly layout,

searchablePrepared.target: responsive, mobile-friendly layout,

index.searchable: a dark and light color scheme,

searchablePrepared.target: a dark and light color scheme,

index.searchable: Prism.js code highlighting,

searchablePrepared.target: Prism.js code highlighting,

index.searchable: Sublime-style client-side search,

searchablePrepared.target: Sublime-style client-side search,

index.searchable: no-dependency on absolute URLs of the final static site,

searchablePrepared.target: no-dependency on absolute URLs of the final static site,

index.searchable: near-100 Lighthouse score of the final static site.

searchablePrepared.target: near-100 Lighthouse score of the final static site.

index.searchable: Quick start

searchablePrepared.target: Quick start

index.searchable: Your first APIdocs website is just a few steps away.

searchablePrepared.target: Your first APIdocs website is just a few steps away.

index.searchable: Clone APIdocs starter project.

searchablePrepared.target: Clone APIdocs starter project.

index.searchable: Install dependencies.

searchablePrepared.target: Install dependencies.

index.searchable: Make sure you have Node.JS version 10 or later and yarn installed. Then fetch APIdocs dependencies:

searchablePrepared.target: Make sure you have Node.JS version 10 or later and yarn installed. Then fetch APIdocs dependencies:

index.searchable: Edit site title and description.

searchablePrepared.target: Edit site title and description.

index.searchable: Open gatsby-config.js and edit metadata of your side located in the siteMetadata node. The title property is the title to display in browser's tab, description is the text to use in the description meta tag. You can also customize the HTML lang attribute.

searchablePrepared.target: Open gatsby-config.js and edit metadata of your side located in the siteMetadata node. The title property is the title to display in browser's tab, description is the text to use in the description meta tag. You can also customize the HTML lang attribute.

index.searchable: Start Gatsby in development mode.

searchablePrepared.target: Start Gatsby in development mode.

index.searchable: Once Gatsby development server starts, open http://localhost:8000 in your browser to see the website you're building. Gatsby will automatically update the page as you edit the content.

searchablePrepared.target: Once Gatsby development server starts, open http://localhost:8000 in your browser to see the website you're building. Gatsby will automatically update the page as you edit the content.

index.searchable: Customize logo and footer.

searchablePrepared.target: Customize logo and footer.

index.searchable: Use your favorite IDE to edit src/logo.html and src/footer.html. Contents of both files must contain valid HTML, but feel free to use in-line SVG to include logos in both files.

searchablePrepared.target: Use your favorite IDE to edit src/logo.html and src/footer.html. Contents of both files must contain valid HTML, but feel free to use in-line SVG to include logos in both files.

index.searchable: Once you save the changes, you should see them applied in real time in the browser.

searchablePrepared.target: Once you save the changes, you should see them applied in real time in the browser.

index.searchable: Start documenting!

searchablePrepared.target: Start documenting!

index.searchable: For each article in your documentation, add an HTML file to the src/content/ folder. The root tag of each HTML file must be an article and it must contain an h1 child tag containing the article's title.

searchablePrepared.target: For each article in your documentation, add an HTML file to the src/content/ folder. The root tag of each HTML file must be an article and it must contain an h1 child tag containing the article's title.

index.searchable: Edit src/navigation.json to add newly-created articles to the navigation menu. Currently, only two-level navigation is supported.

searchablePrepared.target: Edit src/navigation.json to add newly-created articles to the navigation menu. Currently, only two-level navigation is supported.

index.searchable: Build and deploy.

searchablePrepared.target: Build and deploy.

index.searchable: Once you've completed editing your documentation, you can build the final optimized static site by running:

searchablePrepared.target: Once you've completed editing your documentation, you can build the final optimized static site by running:

index.searchable: The public/ folder will contain the static site to deploy.

searchablePrepared.target: The public/ folder will contain the static site to deploy.

index.searchable: Under the hood

searchablePrepared.target: Under the hood

index.searchable: Gatsby plugins

searchablePrepared.target: Gatsby plugins

index.searchable: Why not Markdown?

searchablePrepared.target: Why not Markdown?

index.searchable: APIdocs is based on GatsbyJS.

searchablePrepared.target: APIdocs is based on GatsbyJS.

index.searchable: The general idea behind APIdocs is to enable transformation of interlinked HTML pages to an easily-searchable static site. This approach lets you use any IDE for editing and previewing the source HTML, and things like file name auto-completion or id refactoring just work.

searchablePrepared.target: The general idea behind APIdocs is to enable transformation of interlinked HTML pages to an easily-searchable static site. This approach lets you use any IDE for editing and previewing the source HTML, and things like file name auto-completion or id refactoring just work.

index.searchable: APIdocs implementation consists of the following Gatsby plugins:

searchablePrepared.target: APIdocs implementation consists of the following Gatsby plugins:

index.searchable: @carrotsearch/gatsby-theme-apidocs: a Gatsby theme that implements APIdocs user interface, including navigation menus, search box, logo and footer customization options. The theme also imports all the required plugins described below.

searchablePrepared.target: @carrotsearch/gatsby-theme-apidocs: a Gatsby theme that implements APIdocs user interface, including navigation menus, search box, logo and footer customization options. The theme also imports all the required plugins described below.

index.searchable: @carrotsearch/gatsby-transformer-html: a Gatsby transformer plugin for authoring content in HTML.

searchablePrepared.target: @carrotsearch/gatsby-transformer-html: a Gatsby transformer plugin for authoring content in HTML.

index.searchable: One functional area of the plugin is enriching raw HTML content by:

searchablePrepared.target: One functional area of the plugin is enriching raw HTML content by:

index.searchable: rewriting local links to point to the generated Gatsby pages,

searchablePrepared.target: rewriting local links to point to the generated Gatsby pages,

index.searchable: adding section anchor links,

searchablePrepared.target: adding section anchor links,

index.searchable: processing linked images into multi-resolution responsive img tags,

searchablePrepared.target: processing linked images into multi-resolution responsive img tags,

index.searchable: applying Prism.js highlighting to code blocks,

searchablePrepared.target: applying Prism.js highlighting to code blocks,

index.searchable: embedding code examples from external files,

searchablePrepared.target: embedding code examples from external files,

index.searchable: adding synthetic identifiers to paragraph to make it possible to link to them from content search results.

searchablePrepared.target: adding synthetic identifiers to paragraph to make it possible to link to them from content search results.

index.searchable: Another functional area of the plugin is extracting paragraph-sized text snippets from the page, so that they can be indexed in a client-side in the client-side text search implemented by the gatsby-plugin-content-search plugin

searchablePrepared.target: Another functional area of the plugin is extracting paragraph-sized text snippets from the page, so that they can be indexed in a client-side in the client-side text search implemented by the gatsby-plugin-content-search plugin

index.searchable: The enriched HTML and lists of extracted text snippets are available in Gatsby's GraphQL model for use by other plugins.

searchablePrepared.target: The enriched HTML and lists of extracted text snippets are available in Gatsby's GraphQL model for use by other plugins.

index.searchable: @carrotsearch/gatsby-plugin-content-search: a Gatsby plugin that takes all the text snippets extracted by the HTML transformer plugin and builds a fuzzysortindex for them. Based on that index, a client-side Sublime-like searches can be applied to all the content in your documentation site.

searchablePrepared.target: @carrotsearch/gatsby-plugin-content-search: a Gatsby plugin that takes all the text snippets extracted by the HTML transformer plugin and builds a fuzzysortindex for them. Based on that index, a client-side Sublime-like searches can be applied to all the content in your documentation site.

index.searchable: @carrotsearch/gatsby-plugin-relativize: a Gatsby plugin that post-processes the output to remove the dependency on absolute URLs. The post-processed site should work when deployed at any URL prefix.

searchablePrepared.target: @carrotsearch/gatsby-plugin-relativize: a Gatsby plugin that post-processes the output to remove the dependency on absolute URLs. The post-processed site should work when deployed at any URL prefix.

index.searchable: Additionally, the @carrotsearch/gatsby-theme-apidocs theme uses the following plugins:

searchablePrepared.target: Additionally, the @carrotsearch/gatsby-theme-apidocs theme uses the following plugins:

index.searchable: The majority of Gatsby plugins seems to be centered around Markdown, we also tried it for the initial prototypes of APIdocs. While Markdown has many advantages, such as concise syntax, we found it hard to use for more complex technical documentation:

searchablePrepared.target: The majority of Gatsby plugins seems to be centered around Markdown, we also tried it for the initial prototypes of APIdocs. While Markdown has many advantages, such as concise syntax, we found it hard to use for more complex technical documentation:

index.searchable: Missing features. We wanted to be able to output HTML with arbitrary CSS classes. This is possible through a plugin, but makes the syntax ugly. There is no standard Markdown support for definition lists. This could probably be patched by adding more ugly syntax.

searchablePrepared.target: Missing features. We wanted to be able to output HTML with arbitrary CSS classes. This is possible through a plugin, but makes the syntax ugly. There is no standard Markdown support for definition lists. This could probably be patched by adding more ugly syntax.

index.searchable: Post-processing. To implement client-side search, we'd have to post-process the HTML generated by Markdown. We felt that if we decide to post-process things, we'd rather post-process simple semantic HTML source content rather than Markdown-generated HTML.

searchablePrepared.target: Post-processing. To implement client-side search, we'd have to post-process the HTML generated by Markdown. We felt that if we decide to post-process things, we'd rather post-process simple semantic HTML source content rather than Markdown-generated HTML.

index.searchable: Previewing source content. HTML files can be previewed directly in the browser, IDE support for advanced editing and refactoring is probably better for HTML too.

searchablePrepared.target: Previewing source content. HTML files can be previewed directly in the browser, IDE support for advanced editing and refactoring is probably better for HTML too.

searchablePrepared.target: gatsby-source-filesystem,

searchablePrepared.target: gatsby-plugin-react-helmet,

index.searchable: Variable substitution

searchablePrepared.target: Variable substitution

index.searchable: Defining variables

searchablePrepared.target: Defining variables

index.searchable: Using variables

searchablePrepared.target: Using variables

index.searchable: gatsby-config.js

searchablePrepared.target: gatsby-config.js

index.searchable: Make sure variable values are sanitized!

searchablePrepared.target: Make sure variable values are sanitized!

index.searchable: APIdocs lets you define variables to be substituted with values provided at documentation build time. You can use them to insert timestamps, version numbers and any other dynamic values known at build-time.

searchablePrepared.target: APIdocs lets you define variables to be substituted with values provided at documentation build time. You can use them to insert timestamps, version numbers and any other dynamic values known at build-time.

index.searchable: Substitution variables are defined in the gatsby-config.js file of your documentation project. The list of variables is part of the @carrotsearch/gatsby-theme-apidocs plugin options.

searchablePrepared.target: Substitution variables are defined in the gatsby-config.js file of your documentation project. The list of variables is part of the @carrotsearch/gatsby-theme-apidocs plugin options.

index.searchable: Names of your variables can only contain alphanumeric and underscore characters.

searchablePrepared.target: Names of your variables can only contain alphanumeric and underscore characters.

index.searchable: Since gatsby-config.js is a regular piece of JavaScript code, you can compute variable values based on any resources available to Node.JS, such as environment variables or the contents of the file system.

searchablePrepared.target: Since gatsby-config.js is a regular piece of JavaScript code, you can compute variable values based on any resources available to Node.JS, such as environment variables or the contents of the file system.

index.searchable: Once you have defined your substitution values, you can reference them in the source HTML files surrounded with the % sign:

searchablePrepared.target: Once you have defined your substitution values, you can reference them in the source HTML files surrounded with the % sign:

index.searchable: Version of this documentation: %​APIDOCS_STARTER_VERSION% Build type: %​BUILD_TYPE%

searchablePrepared.target: Version of this documentation: %​APIDOCS_STARTER_VERSION% Build type: %​BUILD_TYPE%

index.searchable: APIdocs will insert the literal values of your variables into the output, HTML tags will not be escaped. Therefore, make sure the values you provide are properly sanitized and don't break the HTML structure of the whole page.
parents: Make sure variable values are sanitized!

searchablePrepared.target: APIdocs will insert the literal values of your variables into the output, HTML tags will not be escaped. Therefore, make sure the values you provide are properly sanitized and don't break the HTML structure of the whole page.
